title: Last Week in Slovakia: Coalition debates early elections
itunes:author: The Slovak Spectator
itunes:summary:
Italian businessman Antonino Vadala was taken into custody Tuesday morning. Police arrested him during an international anti-drug action. 
Either early elections will be held or we will quit the ruling coalition, Most-Hid head Bela Bugar resolutely stated on Monday night. 
Interior Minister Robert Kalinak resigned from his post two weeks after the murder of Jan Kuciak and Martina Kusnirova, yielding to pressure from opposition and the public.

This programme is part of The Slovak Spectator subscription and our readers are receiving it every Thursday morning as part of their subscription. 
More information:

Online+audio: www.sme.sk/predplatne-spectator/
